sentence.Network_en: Two youngsters have been arrested and charged with kidnapping.
sentence.Network_cn: 已有两名年轻人被逮捕并被控绑架。

sentence.Network_en: Set in contemporary Dublin, this pacy thriller features kidnapping, mayhem and murder.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部节奏紧张刺激的惊悚片以当代都柏林为背景，包含了绑架、暴力致人伤残和谋杀情节。

sentence.Network_en: She was arraigned today on charges of assault and kidnapping.
sentence.Network_cn: 她今天因被控人身侵犯和绑架而受到提审。

这种事要是发生在美国,绑架罪(kidnapping)指控是杠杠的。其他伤害、袭击(aggravated assault)等等不在话下。控方调查,定他个绑架罪不难。甚至动用FBI可以挖出他.

entry.def: To kidnap someone is to take them away illegally and by force, and usually to hold them prisoner in order to demand something from their family, employer, or government.

example.ex: Police in Brazil uncovered a plot to kidnap him...
example.tran: 巴西警方发现了有人要绑架他的阴谋。

example.ex: They were intelligent and educated, yet they chose to kidnap and kill...
example.tran: 他们聪明且有教养，却选择去绑架和杀人。

entry.def: Kidnap or a kidnap is the crime of taking someone away by force.

example.ex: Stewart denies attempted murder and kidnap...
example.tran: 斯图尔特否认对其谋杀未遂和绑架的指控。

example.ex: He was charged with the kidnap of a 25 year-old woman.
example.tran: 他被指控绑架一名25岁的女子。

means.word_mean: 1. (law) the unlawful act of capturing and carrying away a person against their will and holding them in false imprisonment
